did.unittitle: Daughters of the American Revolution, Philip Livingston Chapter (Howell, Mich.) Records 1908-2009

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The records were the gift of the chapter (donor no. 10605) and came from Karen P. McNally in several accessions. Additional material came from Howell Carnegie District Library (donor no. 1284) in 2013.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The record group is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Daughters of the American Revolution, Philip Livingston Chapter (Howell, Mich.) Records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The Philip Livingston Chapter of the Daughters of the American Revolution was established in Howell, Michigan in 1908. In 2008, the chapter, still flourishing, celebrated its 100th anniversary.

scopecontent.p: The records of the Philip Livingston Chapter of the Daughters of the American Revolution consist of scrapbooks of clippings and albums of photographs, yearbooks, award citations, and newspaper articles. Other records include historian’s records, secretary’s minute books, treasurer’s records, chapter reports and awards, collected cemetery records of Livingston County, and yearbooks.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The records of the Daughters of the American Revolution of Michigan, also available at the library, include yearbooks and other collected materials of the Philip Livingston Chapter.
